intro: Hieracium exile, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 30 cm. Its flowers are yellow with a central disk, and it has finely divided, grass-like leaves. Hieracium exile is often found in open habitats and can thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
